intro: Zexmenia arnottii var. rugosa, commonly known as the rough zexmenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
